imdb.plot outline: Ashfaqulla Khan (Ashfaq Ulla Khan) (22 October 1900 - 19 December 1927) was a freedom fighter in the Indian independence movement who had given away his life along with Ram Prasad Bismil. Bismil and Ashfaq, both were good friends and Urdu poets (Shayar). Bismil was the pen name or Takhallus of Ram Prasad whereas Ashfaq used to write poetry with the pen name of 'Hasrat'. Both were hanged on the same day, date and time but in different jails.
imdb.title: Mujahid-e-Azadi Ashfaqulla Khan
plot: TV Series On Freedom Fighter Ashfaqulla Khan (22 October 1900 - 19 December 1927)::DD

Ashfaqulla Khan (Ashfaq Ulla Khan) (22 October 1900 - 19 December 1927) was a freedom fighter in the Indian independence movement who had given away his life along with Ram Prasad Bismil. Bismil and Ashfaq, both were good friends and Urdu poets (Shayar). Bismil was the pen name or Takhallus of Ram Prasad whereas Ashfaq used to write poetry with the pen name of 'Hasrat'. Both were hanged on the same day, date and time but in different jails.::DD
